artciles.q: In a liquid limit test, the moisture content at 10 blows was 70% and that at 100 blows was 20%. The liquid limit of the soil, is
The active earth pressure of a soil is proportional to (where φ is the angle of friction of the soil)
The minimum water content at which the soil just begins to crumble when rolled into threads 3 mm in diameter, is known
Pick up the correct statement from the following
option: Below freezing point, higher soil suction develops.
The rise of the ground surface due to frost action is called frost heave.

artciles.q: Which one of the following statements is true ?
option: Clays are more porous than sands
Aluminous cement is used for foundations in soils with chemical deposits

artciles.q: The lateral earth pressure on a retaining wall
option: proportional to the internal friction of the soil
proportional to the depth of the soil
s equal to mass of the soil retained
artciles.answer: proportional to the internal friction of the soil

artciles.q: The internal molecular attraction of a soil, the cohesion
option: increases as the moisture content decreases
is more in well compacted clays
decreases as the moisture content increases
artciles.answer: is more in well compacted clays

artciles.q: The quantity of seepage of water through soils is proportional to
option: total head loss through the soil

artciles.q: When drainage is permitted under initially applied normal stress only and full primarily consolidation is allowed to take place, the test is known as
artciles.description: consolidated undrained test is the best.

artciles.q: The minimum water content at which the soil retains its liquid state and also possesses a small shearing strength against flowing, is known
Minimum size of the particles of silt soil, is
The maximum value of effective stress in the past divided by the present value, is defined as over consolidation ratio (OCR). The O.C.R. of an over consolidated clay is
Under-reamed piles are generally
Pick up the clay soil group which does not swell when wet from the following :

A compacted soil sample using 10% moisture content has a weight of 200 g and mass unit weight of 2.0 g/cm3. If the specific gravity of soil particles and water are 2.7 and 1.0, the degree of saturation of the soil is
A partially saturated sample of soil has a unit weight of 2.0 g/cm3 and specific gravity of soil particles is 2.6. If the moisture content in the soil is 20%, the degree of saturation is
The ratio of the volume of voids to the volume of soil solids in a given soil mass, is known
According to Coulomb's wedge theory, the active earth pressure slides the wedge
option: down and outwards on a slip surface
horizontal upward and parallel to base
horizontal inward and parallel to base.
artciles.answer: down and outwards on a slip surface

artciles.q: The effective size of particles of soil is denoted by
Degree of saturation of a natural soil deposit having water content 15%, specific gravity 2.50 and void ratio 0.5, is
The coefficient of compressibility of soil, is the ratio of
option: rate of loading to that of settlement.

artciles.q: If the failure of a finite slope occurs through the toe, it is known as
Rankine's theory of active earth pressure assumes
option: back of the wall is vertical and smooth

artciles.q: The water content of soil is defined as the ratio of
option: volume of water to volume of given soil
weight of water to weight of solids of given mass of soil.
artciles.answer: weight of water to weight of solids of given mass of soil.

artciles.q: Accurate determination of water content, is made by
artciles.description: oven-drying method is the most Accurate.
